title: Satellites and the specter of IoT attacks
summary: As Internet of Things (IoT) components proliferate in satellites, new cybersecurity risks must be addressed.

title: New effort seeks to study health issues for private astronauts
summary: Medical researchers and commercial spaceflight advocates are working to begin a new effort to study the health issues and risks that space travel poses to a more diverse population of private astronauts.

title: ESA Astronaut Aboard Space Station Controls Robot on Earth
summary:
ESA project astronaut Marcus Wandt successfully completed a series of tests for the Surface Avatar project that included controlling Bert, a four-legged robot developed by DLR. The Surface Avatar project was launched in 2020 and is being run by the German space agency DLR in partnership with ESA. The project aims to develop technology that […]
The post ESA Astronaut Aboard Space Station Controls Robot on Earth appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Rocket Report: Iran reaches orbit; Chinese firm achieves impressive landing test
summary: "Our investors’ continued support is a recognition of our 18 months of hard work."

title: Zeno to recycle decades-old radioactive material to fuel its radioisotope power systems
summary: Zeno Power Systems is partnering with the U.S. Department of Energy to recycle decades-old radioactive material to produce radioisotope power sources.

title: Northrop charges on lunar Gateway module program reach $100 million
summary: Northrop Grumman has taken another charge on its contract to build a module for NASA’s lunar Gateway, bringing its losses for the year on that program to $100 million.

title: Farewell to Ingenuity, NASA’s Plucky Mars Helicopter
summary: NASA’s Ingenuity helicopter has made its last flight on Mars. The plucky technology demonstrator that engineers were not sure would fly at all in the thin Martian atmosphere made 72 […]

title: Lockheed Martin, Boeing win contracts to design U.S. military narrowband communications satellites
summary: Lockheed Martin and Boeing each won a $66 million contract to design a narrowband communications satellite to expand the existing network known as the Mobile User Objective System.

title: Wet Dress Rehearsal on the Horizon for Starship Flight 3
summary: SpaceX is deep into preparations for the next Starship flight, focusing on the Orbital Launch Pad (OLP). Booster 10 and Ship 28 are set to return to the launch site in the coming week or two, ahead of a Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) that will set the stage for the third launch of the world’s largest and most powerful rocket.

title: Ingenuity’s Mission Comes to an End
summary: On January 25, 2024, NASA’s Ingenuity mission officially concluded. The small, autonomous helicopter performed 72 flights on Mars, the first time an aircraft has flown on another planet. This mission far exceeded the 5 planned demonstration flights and captivated the world, following the journey of the intrepid little helicopter that could as it soared to new heights on the Red Planet.
